result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Dion Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andre Dion Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andre Dion Johnson was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Andre Dion Johnson was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Andre Dion Johnson was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge as to count one.  No DNA surcharge ordered on counts three and four because it is ordered on count one.
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  pay all costs and surcharges.  The DNA surcharge, costs and surcharges to be paid out of up to 25% of prison funds/wages. Any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE, THREE, AND FOUR: concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for six days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims Andreana P., Chyna B., Alexcis C., A.P. and Latreece T.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE

Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.
**Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years Initial Confinement in this case.

Defendant Andre Dion Johnson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Andre Dion Johnson in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statements by Latreece T. and Briana J.  

AS TO ALL COUNTS 1, 3, 4, ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 6 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Adreana P., Chyna B., Alexcis C., A.P. and Latreece T.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Anger Management.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds/wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. 

- No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered on counts 3 and 4 because it is ordered on count 1.

- AS TO ALL COUNTS: Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds/wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits filed.
filed.

Defendant Andre Dion Johnson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre Dion Johnson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.   Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 1:53 pm.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for the defense:  Andre Johnson.  Jury out of box at 2:05 pm.  Jury in box at 3:22 pm.  Jury out of box at 3:24.  Court recessed for the day.  Jury trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
